Import Data

When the “pyxml.py” file is run on the Spyder IDE, the GUI shown in Figure 1 opens. The “Import Data” tab is the default tab of PyXML. “Browse” button allows selecting the dataset from the computer’s memory.

Clicking on the “Browse” button opens a file dialog allowing to navigate through the computer’s memory and select the data set to load, as shown in Figure 2. Loading a sample data set from the computer is shown in Figure 2. Note: Please note that PyXML only supports “.csv” file formats; any other file formats are ignored. However, a few lines of code in the source code can be modified to allow different file types to be opened, such as xlsx. PyXML assumes that the dataset is organized in a numeric data type, with attributes at the beginning and the class label at the end.

Upon clinking “Open” in the file dialog loaded dataset is displayed in the “Import data” tab, as shown in Figure 3. The data path of the loaded dataset can be seen next to the “Load Input Data” label. Additionally, the horizontal scroll bar can be used to scroll left/right and the vertical scroll bar can be used to scroll up and down to display features and instances that are not visible due to the size of the dataset.
